content:
Congratulations on creating a branded hashtag, #SweatWithSamantha! Having 15 users adopt it is a great start. Here are some tips to increase the adoption of your branded hashtag:

1. **Promote it consistently**: Continue to promote your hashtag on all your social media platforms, including Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and TikTok. Use it in your bio, posts, stories, and IGTV descriptions.
2. **Make it clear what it's for**: Educate your audience on what your hashtag is for and how to use it. You can create a post or a story explaining that #SweatWithSamantha is for sharing fitness-related content, and that you'll feature your favorite posts on your page.
3. **Incentivize users**: Offer incentives for users to share their own fitness content using your hashtag. This could be a shoutout on your page, a free workout routine, or even a discount code for your online fitness programs.
4. **Feature user-generated content**: Share user-generated content (UGC) on your page, and give credit to the original poster. This will encourage others to share their content, hoping to be featured on your page.
5. **Collaborate with influencers**: Partner with other fitness influencers or enthusiasts in your niche to promote your hashtag. They can share their own content using your hashtag, and you can do the same for them.
6. **Run a contest or challenge**: Host a contest or challenge that encourages users to share their fitness journey using your hashtag. This could be a " Transformation Tuesday" challenge or a "Workout of the Week" contest.
7. **Add it to your website**: Display your branded hashtag on your website, especially on pages related to fitness or workouts. This will help visitors discover your hashtag and encourage them to share their own content.
8. **Use it in email marketing**: Include your hashtag in your email newsletters or promotional emails to reach a broader audience.
9. **Monitor and engage**: Regularly monitor your hashtag and engage with users who post using it. Like, comment, and respond to their content to build a community around your brand.
10. **Be patient**: Building a branded hashtag takes time and effort. Don't get discouraged if you don't see immediate results. Keep promoting, engaging, and incentivizing, and you'll see the adoption rate increase over time.

Remember, the key to a successful branded hashtag is to make it a part of your overall brand identity and to consistently promote it across all your platforms. Good luck!
